content.description:
How you climb this route is going to depend on you and your belayer's willingness to walk into tick infested bushes. Either start from directly under the bolt line, or traverse in along the giant left slanting weakness, skipping the first bolt and promising your belayer that you won't fall (as they will swing into the bushes).

Climb up sustained terrain, "easy" terrain on slightly slopey holds. While there are probably no individual 5.10 moves, the slightly slopey hands will give you that 5.10 pump! 

Cool features, scenic climb!

Farthest left on climb on the face, starts out of the cluster of tree-bushes at the bottom. Anchors are out of view from the base, but are at the weakness in the arete. 
5 bolts, 2 bolt anchor

Nothing to right home about- decent movement on poor quality rock. Slightly run out to the 3rd bolt (bad rock, no place to put a bolt).

Farthest right bolt line of the face. 
3 bolts, 2 bolt anchor

Rad climbing in a scenic location!

Follow the flake system trending up and right. Clip-up and pull a small roof, finish out the face! 

Trust that the high first bolt is safe, long draw the bolt on the roof. 

Second bolt line from the left.
5 bolts, 2 bolt anchor

This sector gets morning sun, and afternoon shade. The belay from the plateau half way up the main bluff makes the location super cool, and the rock has features not found anywhere else at the crag. Unfortunately, there are only 3 climbs on this face, 1 of which you can definitely skip!
